channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Ben Smart, Olivia Hope and Scott Watson: A timeline
item.description: Yesterday's announcement that Scott Watson's case is going back to the Court of Appeal is just the latest chapter in the long story that started with the disappaerance of Olivia Hope and Ben Smart, 21 years ago.

item.title: One of two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand visited Auckland Hospital
item.description: There have been two new cases of Covid-19 reported today, both in managed isolation, although one was taken to Auckland Hospital with a different medical condition for a short period.

item.title: Teenager Jawsh 685 at top of iTunes: 'I made it for people to blast it on sirens'
item.description: South Auckland teenager Jawsh 685 - whose tunes from his tiny bedroom led to worldwide smash 'Savage Love' - is getting major label interest, but has to go to his school ball first.

item.title: Sirocco: The celibate spokesbird worth $80,000
item.description: He lives on a secret island, flies in private aircraft and has more than 230,000 online fans. Despite being flightless and effectively celibate, one hand-reared kākāpō might be the closest thing NZ has to royalty.

item.title: Aotearoa needs to debate colonisation, racism - new commissioner
item.description: The new commissioner of the Royal Commission into historical abuse in state care says she was an adult before she realised the hugely negative impact of colonisation on Māori.

item.title: Tornado hits northern Auckland: 'Devastation was left behind'
item.description: A Dairy Flat resident says a tornado last night sounded like a plane crashing into her house, while another this morning hit industrial buildings in East Tamaki.

item.title: Govt looks to Australia as it mulls charging for isolation costs
item.description: The government is deciding if and how they will require returning New Zealanders to partially pay for their Covid-19 managed isolation costs.

item.title: Principal surprised by isolation drop-off during school pickup
item.description: A primary school principal has no concerns about a hotel opposite being used as a managed isolation facility - but she was surprised the guests arrived during school pickup time.

item.title: 4.9 quake centred near Rotorua
item.description: A light earthquake has rattled the central North Island about 8.40am today.

item.title: Disability sector calls for separate ministry, support unshackled from health system
item.description: The government should abandon some recommendations in the "appalling" Health and Disability review, and set up a separate ministry, people across the disability sector say.

item.title: Classical on Cuba to be Wellington's first festival since lockdown
item.description: Wellington's struggling music scene is getting a boost this weekend with its first festival since the lockdown ended.

item.title: Deportees set to spend isolation in same facilities as other travellers
item.description: New Zealanders deported from Australia will go into the same managed isolation and quarantine facilities as other arrivals.

item.title: Appeal for sightings of car in fatal Manukau hit-and-run
item.description: A 79-year-old man was the victim of a fatal hit-and-run in Counties Manukau last night.

item.title: Northland residents asked to conserve water
item.description: The Whangārei District Council is urging residents to continue conserving water, even though restrictions have been lifted.

item.title: NZers left country during lockdown, returned via stays in managed isolation
item.description: Official figures show 60 people left the country after alert level 4 restrictions were introduced, and returned before May.

item.title: 'We saw some birds get sucked into it': Tornado touches down in Mangawhai
item.description: Mangawhai residents have witnessed birds and roofs being pulled into the vortex as a tornado touched down at the coastal town north of Auckland.

item.title: Travellers from South Korea taken to isolation hotel in Wellington
item.description: New Zealanders returning home on a repatriation flight from South Korea have been taken to a managed isolation hotel in Wellington today, a first for the capital.

item.title: Scott Watson’s murder convictions to be referred to Court of Appeal
item.description: The Governor-General has referred Scott Watson's convictions for murder back to the Court of Appeal, Justice Minister Andrew Little has announced.
